snippet: The past few weeks have been consumed by competing accounts of how Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and the United Federation of Teachers lost $240 million for city schools.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column observes that competing accounts about failed labor negotiations cost New York City schools $240 million in state and federal funds make it seem as though the Education Dept and the union sat not in a single negotiating room, but on far sides of the moon from each other.
lead_paragraph: The past few weeks have been consumed by competing accounts of how Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and the United Federation of Teachers lost $240 million for city schools.

headline.seo: Clashing Explanations on How Talks With Teachers Union Failed
headline.main: Explaining, or Maybe Not, Failure in Talks With Teachers
headline.print_headline: Explaining, Or Maybe Not, Failure in Talks With Teachers
